poem:
"Anatomy of a Yawn"

Why is a yawn contagious but a smile sometimes not?
Mirror neurons dance in electric thought,
Catching whispers of tiredness, echoed and taught.
Outnumbering the clouds, these signals are sought,
And your mouth gapes wide, in empathy caught,
A shared human canvas, subtly wrought.
